channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AR

item.title: Report X-2023100982
item.description:
Report X-2023100982

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-05
  • City: MABELVALE
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Damaged fully regulated package was found in loading work area DescribePack: Upon inspection one of the containers of green printing ink had a loose cap which had caused internal leakage DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Damaged fully regulated package was placed inside of a hazmat plastic bag

item.title: Report X-2023100796
item.description:
Report X-2023100796

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-17
  • City: FAYETTEVILLE
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Freight was loaded into city trailer, the shipment was refused at consignee location. The consignee observed drops of liquid and a crack ~and believed the tote had a pinhole/crack. The consignee believes this to be a defect in the tote, not the result of improper loading or a ~puncture. There is no evidence to suggest that this tote was improperly loaded.

item.title: Report E-2023110201

  • Description: Associate did not block and/or brace freight properly for transport. Freight was crushed causing release of product.
